column4: UPDATE 1-Hong Kong investigates HSBC  other banks for inappropriate market conduct
column5: June 18 Hong Kong's de facto central bank said on Tuesday that its investigation into possible benchmark rate manipulation has been extended to include HSBC and a number of other banks.

column5: DUBAI  June 18 Saudi International Petrochemical Co (Sipchem) has picked HSBC Holdings to advise on the firm's proposed merger with Sahara Petrochemical   three banking sources said on Tuesday.

column4: JCI looks to private equity to sell auto electronics unit: sources
column5: NEW YORK/DETROIT Johnson Controls Inc  is speaking to private equity firms about selling its roughly $1 billion automotive electronics unit  after buyout interest from many rival auto parts suppliers faltered  according to several people familiar with the matter.

column4: Kimberly-Clark moves to ease Venezuelan toilet paper shortage
column5: CARACAS Kimberly-Clark Corp is planning a 234 million bolivar ($37.1 mln) investment to expand operations in Venezuela  the state news agency said  in a move that should help ease an embarrassing national shortage of toilet paper.

column4: Jefferies profit slumps as fixed-income trading takes a hit
column5: Investment bank Jefferies Group LLC  which is now part of Leucadia National Corp   reported a 34 percent drop in quarterly profit as uncertainty about the U.S. Federal Reserve's stimulus program hurt fixed-income trading.

column5: LONDON British bank Lloyds  has denied being subject to political pressure to sell hundreds of branches to the Co-operative Group   rebutting suggestions of ministerial interference in the controversial sale.

column4: M&T Bank to fix anti-money laundering flaws  Fed says
column5: WASHINGTON M&T Bank Corp  will put a comprehensive plan in place to fix problems with its anti-money laundering policies that had caused regulators to put a hold on its $3.7 billion bid to buy Hudson City Bancorp.

column4: Russia's Mechel launches $100 mln share buyback programme
column5: MOSCOW  June 18 Russian miner Mechel   said on Tuesday it would launch a share buy back programme of up to $100 million  after it reported a first-quarter net loss of $321 million partly due to weak prices.

column4: Janney hires Morgan Stanley adviser team in Maryland
column5: Philadelphia-based brokerage Janney Montgomery Scott LLC has hired a team of veteran advisers from Morgan Stanley Wealth Management to join its private client group in Maryland  Janney said on Tuesday.

column4: Cambodian garment workers charged over strike violence
column5: PHNOM PENH Sixteen Cambodian garment workers and union representatives have been charged with inciting violence and damaging property during a strike for higher pay at a factory making clothes for U.S. sportswear company Nike  a lawyer said on Tuesday.

column4: U.S. court finds Novo Nordisk Prandin diabetes drug patent invalid
column5: A U.S. appeals court found the patent on Novo Nordisk's Prandin diabetes drug in combination with metformin to be invalid  paving the way for introduction of a generic version of the medicine  the Danish drugmaker said on Tuesday.

column5: NEW YORK  June 18 U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday  led by growth-oriented sectors  as Federal Reserve policymakers gathered for a two-day meeting to discuss the future of the Fed's bond-buying to stimulate the economy.

column5: NEW YORK  June 18 U.S. stocks were set to tick up at the open on Tuesday ahead of the start of a highly-anticipated Federal Reserve meeting.

column4: U.S. lawmakers urge careful review of American-US Airways deal
column5: WASHINGTON Two U.S. lawmakers with antitrust oversight have urged the Obama administration to carefully review a planned merger of American Airlines  and US Airways Group  to ensure that it will not lead to higher prices for air travelers.

column4: UPDATE 2-Sprint sues Dish  Clearwire as key deadline looms
column5: June 17 Sprint Nextel Corp on Monday said it has sued Dish Network Corp to block its tender offer for Clearwire Corp  on the eve of a key deadline in a takeover battle that also includes Japanese mobile carrier SoftBank Corp.

column5: PARIS  June 18 U.S. arms makers see rising foreign demand for fighter jets  missile defense systems and other weapons as countries modernise their forces and U.S. officials  facing tighter budgets  encourage allies to invest more in intelligence gathering and aerial refueling equipment.

column4: Crystal  Goodman head back to school in 'Monsters University'
column5: LOS ANGELES  June 18 One-eyed green monster Mike Wazowski and his giant blue  furry friend James P. "Sully" Sullivan go back in time as "scaring" students in "Monsters University " as Walt Disney Co.'s Pixar Animation Studios pins its hopes for a blockbuster on the coming-of-age story.

column4: UPDATE 1-Western Union sees $500 mln online revenue by 2015 - CEO

column4: RLPC-Acromas refinancing paves way to split AA  Saga
column5: LONDON  June 18 Acromas  owner of British motoring services firm the AA and over 50s insurance firm Saga  is refinancing 3.062 billion pounds of existing debt to pave the way for a break up of the company.
